questions.question_text: In a Business Rule, which one of the following returns the sys_id of the currently logged in user?

Access Control debug information identifies whether each element of an Access Control granted or denied access. The elements appear in the debug information in the order of evaluation. In which order are the elements of an Access Control evaluated?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Still roles first, condition and then script. all must be true to pass acl

Selected Answer: C
See others info as to why.

Selected Answer: C
The sequence is: Roles, Condition, Script.
That's what the annotation on the access control tab in studio says.
the blue definition in the official docs defines the order https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/contextual-security/concept/access-control-rules.html

Selected Answer: C
"The sequence is ROLES first, then condition, then script." - Chuck Tomasi says so at this link: 
https://www.servicenow.com/community/grc-forum/order-of-execution-of-an-acl/m-p/1311962/highlight/true#M6538
Correct answer is C
